  "DOCTOR: Can you describe what your rash looks and feels like\u2014does it itch or hurt\u2014and tell me more about how high your fever has been?",
  "PATIENT: d whether it's something serious. My face and chest are really covered in this reddish rash now, but it kind of itches and burns a little, though it's worse on my face. The fever has been up and down, but",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly how high your fever has been, how it feels when you have the rash\u2014does it itch, burn, or hurt\u2014and whether you're experiencing any other symptoms like muscle aches, sore throat, or trouble breathing?",
  "PATIENT: Well, my fever\u2019s been up and down, maybe around 101 or so, and it doesn\u2019t really hurt but it makes me feel really exhausted, like I could nap forever.   "DOCTOR: \"Can you tell me exactly when the rash first appeared in relation to your fever\u2014the day it started, and whether it has changed or spread since then?\"",
  "PATIENT: Well, um, I think the rash showed up yesterday, I\u2019m pretty sure it started on my face and then kinda spread down my body pretty fast, but I can\u2019t remember the exact day. I was actually just thinking about my cousin yesterday\u2014she had something like this, and they said it was rubella\u2014so I\u2019ve been kind of worried if it\u2019s the same thing, especially with the travel plans coming up.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly on which day your rash first appeared and how it has changed or spread since then, starting from when you first noticed it?",
  "PATIENT: Um, I think it was yesterday when the rash appeared, but I noticed it on my face first and now it's kinda everywhere, like down my arms and chest. It\u2019s kinda spread out and I don\u2019t remember getting anything like this before, but I did talk to my coworker last week who was coughing a lot, so maybe it\u2019s that?",
  "DOCTOR: \"Can you tell me about the exact day when your rash first started\u2014do you remember if it appeared before or after your fever and feeling tired\u2014and how it has changed or spread since then?\"",
  "PATIENT: Well, I think it all kind of started with the sore throat and feeling super tired, like I just couldn\u2019t shake it.   "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly which day your rash first appeared in relation to when you started feeling your fever\u2014that is, did the rash come before, after, or at the same time as your fever started?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I think the fever started before the rash\u2014like, I was feeling really tired and hot, and then yesterday the rash appeared all of a sudden, first on my face and then spreading.   "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly which day your fever and sore throat started, and whether the rash appeared after those symptoms, or if they came on at the same time or earlier?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I guess it all began about three days ago when I started feeling really tired and had a sore throat.   "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly which day your rash first appeared in relation to when your fever, sore throat, or lymph node swelling started\u2014that is, did the rash come before, after, or at the same time as these other symptoms?",

  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me exactly when you first noticed the rash\u2014did it come after your sore throat and fever started, or at a different time\u2014and how it has changed or spread since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, it kind of started with this sore throat and feeling really wiped out, and then yesterday I woke up and saw the rash on my face, and it's now sort of spreading down my body.
